title: The Developers Guide to GenAI
text: Source: https://www.wired.com/story/how-software-engineers-coders-actually-use-ai/

title: The Developers Guide to GenAI
text:
Biggest Challenge: Specificity

    
      
        ‚ö†Ô∏è
      

      
        
          GenAI will fail when given tasks that are:
        
        
          
            ‚úò Too complex without breakdown
          
          
            ‚úò Ambiguous in requirements
          
          
            ‚úì Break down complex tasks
          
          
            ‚úì Be specific in instructions
          
        
      
    

    
      
        "The quality of your output is directly proportional to the specificity of your input."

title: The Developers Guide to GenAI
text:
"The more it reasons, the more unpredictable it becomes"
        ‚Äî Ilya Sutskever

title: The Developers Guide to GenAI
text:
‚öîÔ∏è Model Tiers: Choose Your Weapon!
Most model providers offer a range of models, often tiered by capability and cost:




üëë Flagship Models

  ‚úÖ Complex reasoning, high accuracy, creative tasks.
  ‚ö†Ô∏è Slower, more expensive.

Examples: OpenAI o1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet, Gemini 2.5 Pro, Llama 4 Behemoth



‚öñÔ∏è Balanced Models

  ‚úÖ Good balance of performance, speed, and cost for general use.
  ‚ö†Ô∏è May not match flagship on the most complex tasks.

Examples: GPT-4o, Claude 3.7 Sonnet (Non reasoning)



‚ö° Fast/Lite Models

  ‚úÖ High throughput, low latency, simple tasks, cost-sensitive applications.
  ‚ö†Ô∏è Less capable reasoning, potentially lower accuracy.

Examples: GPT-4o-mini, Claude 3.5 Haiku, Gemini 2.0 Flash and Flash-lite




Key takeaway: Match the model tier to your specific needs and budget!





  üß† Claude 3.7 Sonnet
  üéÆ Type:Reasoning & Coding
  üß© Input: Text, Image
  üñº Output: Text
  üìè Context: 200K tokens
  üõ† Function Calling: ‚úÖ
  üèóÔ∏è Structured Output: ‚úÖ
  ü§î Reasoning: ‚úÖ
  üíª Special Ability: Computer Use (mouse, keyboard, browser)
  
  üí™ Strengths:
  
    Amazing coder
    Caches content
    Performs autonomous computer tasks
  
  ‚ö†Ô∏è Weaknesses:
  
    No image output
  



  ‚ú® Gemini 2.0 Flash
  ‚ö° Type: Speed & Efficiency / Long Context
  üß© Input: Text, Image, Audio, Video, Voice
  üñº Output: Text, Voice
  üìè Context: 1M tokens
  üõ† Function Calling: ‚úÖ
  üèóÔ∏è Structured Output: ‚úÖ
  ü§î Reasoning: ‚ùå
  
  üí™ Strengths:
  
    Very fast response times
    Cost-effective
    Excellent for long context tasks
    Good for high-volume/frequency tasks
  
  ‚ö†Ô∏è Weaknesses:
  
    Less performant on highly complex reasoning vs Pro
  




  üß† DeepSeek-R1 (OS)
  üí° Type: Coding & Technical Reasoning
  üß© Input: Text, Images (VL variant)
  üñº Output: Text
  üìè Context: 128K tokens
  üõ† Function Calling: ‚ùå
  üèóÔ∏è Structured Output: üî∂
  ü§î Reasoning:‚úÖ
  
  üí™ Strengths:
  
    Exceptional coding & mathematical reasoning
    Strong multilingual capabilities (Chinese+English)
    Open-source
  
  ‚ö†Ô∏è Weaknesses:
  
    Fewer modalities than some competitors
    Less robust content moderation

text: Law Adoption Rate
